modules.name: Module 1
modules.description: Speak back short vowel sounds in simple everyday sentences.
speechGroups: A big cat sat on the mat.
He runs from the sun.
The bus stops at the park.
A red apple is on the table.
The clock ticks at midnight.
Can you pass the salt?
Take the last cookie from the jar.
That hat looks too flat.
Grab the map from the back.
Act fast, or it's gone.

modules.name: Module 2
modules.description: Practice long vowel sounds with clearer, drawn-out words.
speechGroups: Open the window in the evening.
Trees shade the wide path.
Birds fly over the new lake.
These shoes are too tight.
The queen waves to the crowd.
He speaks in a clear voice.
Keep the secret between us.
Feed the geese at the pond.
Leave the piece on the bench.
The field lies beyond the stream.

modules.name: Module 3
modules.description: Repeat phrases with soft and rounded vowel tones.
speechGroups: Pull the rope up the hill.
Put the book on the shelf.
A small mouse ran under the chair.
The dog jumps over the log.
Dust covers the old clock.
A full moon lights the path.
Push the cart up the slope.
The monk prays alone.
She cut the cord.
Luck comes to those who try.

modules.name: Module 4
modules.description: Repeat deeper vowel sounds with accuracy.
speechGroups: The cold frost covers the plants.
Hold the bold colors high.
He sold the old, gold ring.
The fold in the note was sharp.
Colt ran across the field.
The toll for the bridge went up.
Mold grows on the cold brick.
They told tales by the fire.
Scold less, and listen more.
Soldiers march down the road.

modules.name: Module 1
modules.description: Listen for clear consonants and repeat the full sentence.
speechGroups: Mark jumped over the fence.
A dog chased the rolling ball.
The cat scratched the couch.
Birds flew south for winter.
Children played in the park.
He dropped the glass on the floor.
Cars honked loudly in traffic.
She wrote a letter to her friend.
The wind blew the leaves around.
Firefighters rushed to the scene.

modules.name: Module 2
modules.description: Catch tricky blends and repeat what you hear.
speechGroups: A tree fell across the road.
The book fell off the shelf.
Rain poured down all day.
She tied her shoes tightly.
The curtain fluttered in the breeze.
Balloons floated up into the sky.
He whispered a secret to her.
Waves crashed against the shore.
A duck quacked in the distance.
Keys jingled in his pocket.

modules.name: Module 3
modules.description: Hear and echo sentences with sharper consonant sounds.
speechGroups: The clock ticked loudly at night.
A branch snapped under the weight.
Kids shouted in the playground.
She brushed her hair quickly.
He locked the door before leaving.
Leaves rustled in the wind.
A frog leaped into the pond.
Paper crumpled in his hand.
The drummer banged on the drums.
Lightning flashed across the sky.

modules.name: Module 4
speechGroups: She grabbed her bag and left.
He slumped into the chair tiredly.
The teacher called out our names.
A bee buzzed near the flowers.
They stacked the boxes in the corner.
A squirrel scampered up the tree.
Footsteps echoed in the hallway.
A pen dropped on the floor.
She sniffed the fresh pie.
The gate creaked as it opened.

modules.name: Module 1
modules.description: Repeat questions and exclamations exactly as you hear them.
speechGroups: Are you coming to the party?
He actually won the lottery!
Could you please open the window?
Wow, that was an amazing show!
Do you know where my keys are?
Hurry up, we're going to be late!
What did you think of the movie?
Look out for the broken glass!
How old were you when you moved here?
I can't believe you did that!

modules.name: Module 2
modules.description: Speak with expressive pitch and emotional emphasis.
speechGroups: Did it really happen?
She's the best player on the team!
Can you help me with this problem?
That’s a beautiful painting!
Where is the nearest grocery store?
Be careful with that vase!
What time does the train leave?
Watch your step on the ice!
Who told you that story?
It's so nice to see you again!

modules.name: Module 3
modules.description: Listen closely to pitch and phrasing before repeating.
speechGroups: Why are you whispering?
The concert was absolutely fantastic!
May I borrow your phone charger?
That’s exactly what I wanted!
How do you get to the airport from here?
Keep your voice down in the library.
When is the deadline for this project?
Don’t forget to lock the door!
Have you met the new neighbor?
Thank you so much for your help!

modules.name: Module 4
modules.description: Repeat full sentences with natural rhythm and tone accuracy.
speechGroups: Is this seat taken?
I never expected to win!
Could you say that again, please?
Incredible, how did you do it?
Where were you last night?
Stay back from the edge!
What would you like for dinner?
Be quiet during the movie!
Who will join us for lunch?
I’m really proud of you!
